channel.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
channel.description:
since lots of people have been asking me to speed up the process on this, ill explain the situation we are in.
1. Waiting on moparisthebest to set us up some forums, or give me the abilities too. 2. Waiting on ollie or any other web developer to set up a simple (http://localhost/auth.php?user=xxx&pass=xxx) so moparisthebest can call that to integrate registration into smf forums 3. Waiting on moparisthebest to setup our server onto his linux box.
then beta!
ill tick these off as they become complete.

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:33, topic:393190”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=490361.msg3588807#msg3588807 date=1304397117]
It’s in xEnt’s hands right now, I’m waiting for an RSC client that runs in MoparScape 4, and the authentication (user/pass) code needs written.
[/quote]
could you pm me the link to the url to that page? so i can try it again’st the moparscape server from my computer. host that test1-9 db i gave you, thanks.[/quote]
I pm’d you the link to the auth page and instructions. Fill out the RSC name in your profile to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

And it’s the only way that forum accounts can be associated to RSC accounts. Which can be used for any number of things, high scores, showing when you are in-game, etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @blown_away blown away
item.description:
@blown_away wrote:

I don’t see the problem with creating an account on the forum anyway rofl. Unless they’re using easyRSC, I’ve never seen another source have client registration, and all you complaining about this already have a mopar account. And to add to it, every other server uses creation on the website anyway, why would mopar be any different? simple, easy, takes 2 seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I know at least on RS2 317-377 they had a ‘create account’ button on the client but when clicked it just told you to go to the website to register an account.

Regardless, you all already have an account on here, so all you need to do is go to your profile and put your RSC name, when I add that field.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:393190”][quote author=Motaro link=topic=490361.msg3588017#msg3588017 date=1304354124]
Why not make registration how RSC (and current RS) is?

It’s quick, easy, and doesn’t require an account or anything to make.
[/quote]

I haven’t played RS in a long time, but you always had to manually register an account, right? That’s all you have to do here on the forum as well.[/quote]

In RS you just click the create a character button and go from there. You didn’t need to have an account on the website like you do in servers nowadays.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @dear_god1 dear god
item.description:
@dear_god1 wrote:

[quote=“dexto, post:23, topic:393190”][quote author=dear god link=topic=490361.msg3588309#msg3588309 date=1304372599]

In runescape classic you made an account through the client.

maybe when it first started. in rsc you registered through the website, just like with rs2
[/quote]
ya i made my chars through the client, but runescape has then moved it on to the website only.[/quote]
now that i think about it, i do remember a create account button on the client, would be pretty cool to have that instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

-Nothing:

So are you saying that only people registered at mopar can play?

Yes, but the registration is free and easy, so why is that a problem?

[quote=“dexto, post:15, topic:393190”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=490361.msg3587922#msg3587922 date=1304342442]
So are you saying that only people registered at mopar can play?
[/quote]
Even if it’s like that, it’s still the same for if there was a external forum, would have to sign up there aswell.
Except, it might be just on this forum + we’ll get a new forum area for Mopar-RSC or so[/quote]

If I set up another forum, it will have the same user-accounts just like this forum, moparisthebest.com, and moparcraft.net, the same account works on all of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Classic - Checklist to Beta
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:11, topic:393190”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=490361.msg3587601#msg3587601 date=1304305239]
The auth.php is already set up and written by me, you need to put code that checks that in the RSC server itself.
[/quote]

i don’t get it, do you think we are creating characters through the client or something? that’s RS2, with RSC it was creating an account/char through web…[/quote]

No, you will create your character on the forum, by putting in a name in your profile page (like your minecraft name now).

Then the server will just send the user/pass to that auth.php page to check whether the user/pass is correct.

Read full topic
